<div class="c6 " style="margin-bottom:7px">
<!-- <![endif]-->
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<th class="card" style="text-align:left;font-weight:400;font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#333;display:block;background-color:#fff;border-radius:15px;border:1px solid #e6e6e6;border-collapse:collapse;box-shadow:none;margin-bottom:0px">
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding: 15px;">
<h3 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0">
TELEMEDICINE
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2020/06/12/telemedicine-soars-pandemic-restrictions?email={{profile.email}}" target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;">
<font color="#000000">
Waiting Rooms, We Won’t Miss You
</font></a>
</h1>
</td>
</tr>
</table>
<img alt="Telemedicine" style="display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;" width="670" class="story-header-image" src="https://dlp31coh2a67q.cloudfront.net/eyJrZXkiOiJ1cGxvYWRzL21lZGl1bS9hc3NldC8xMzI5L3RlbGVtZWRpY2luZS5qcGciLCJidWNrZXQiOiJvc2xvLXByb2R1Y3Rpb24iLCJlZGl0cyI6eyJyZXNpemUiOnsid2lkdGgiOjEwMDAsImhlaWdodCI6bnVsbH19fQ==">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px;">
<small><em>Francis Scialabba</em></small>
</p>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding:15px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">The coronavirus pandemic has resulted in never-before-seen experiments around remote work, the metaverse, and finally embracing leggings as real pants. It’s also created a budding star in healthcare: telemedicine.</p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>The U.S. government defines telemedicine as the use of information and communication technologies to provide clinical healthcare services. “Telehealth” implies both clinical and non-clinical services, though it's often used interchangeably with telemedicine.</span></li>
</ul>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">COVID-19 could be the tipping point.</strong> Virtual doctor visits jumped from ~12,000/week to more than 1 million/week during the pandemic. “Physicians have now basically crossed the rubicon,” NY Presbyterian CEO Steven Corwin <a href="https://fortune.com/2020/06/11/coronavirus-covid-19-pandemic-telehealth-brainstorm-health/?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">told Fortune</a>.</p>
<h2 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0">So what's in the way?</h2>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">While it's not new, telemedicine hasn’t been a top priority for providers or insurers. Virtual visits can be <a href="https://www.nationalgeographic.com/science/2020/06/why-rural-hospitals-may-not-survive-coronavirus-telemedicine/#close?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">less profitable</a> than in-person services, especially for rural hospitals. Regulatory barriers have also <a href="https://www.brookings.edu/research/removing-regulatory-barriers-to-telehealth-before-and-after-covid-19/?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">created uncertainty</a> around telemedicine’s future.  </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">For patients, Medicare, Medicaid, or insurance don’t always cover the cost of virtual care. In rural areas (where telehealth is <em>especially</em> helpful in plugging healthcare gaps), many people lack tech or broadband access.</p>
<h2 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0">The COVID-19 pilot </h2>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">When the pandemic began, federal officials relaxed telemedicine rules. They <a href="https://www.kff.org/womens-health-policy/issue-brief/opportunities-and-barriers-for-telemedicine-in-the-u-s-during-the-covid-19-emergency-and-beyond/?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">waived</a> certain Medicare requirements and allowed doctors to practice across state lines and virtually prescribe more medications. </p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>Many states also expanded Medicaid telehealth coverage and relaxed licensing restrictions. Some required that private insurance plans cover and reimburse telemedicine as much as in-person visits. </span></li>
</ul>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Centers for Medicare and Medicaid Services Administrator Seema Verma is pleased with early results and wants the U.S. to continue <a href="https://www.statnews.com/2020/06/09/seema-verma-telehealth-access-covid19/?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">expanding</a> telemedicine access. But there are still some wrinkles to iron out, including...</p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>Whether Medicare/Medicaid should pay out the same for virtual appointments</span></li>
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>Expanding eligible services to include emergency care, physical therapy, and mental health </span></li>
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>Bringing virtual care to home consults, hospices, and nursing homes</span></li>
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>Easing licensing rules so telemedicine can cross state lines  </span></li>
</ul>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Looking ahead...</strong>Verma said health officials are searching for ways to boost telemedicine. However, only Congress can permanently expand it to more patients and healthcare plans.</p>

<!-- <![endif]-->
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<th class="card" style="text-align:left;font-weight:400;font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#333;display:block;background-color:#fff;border-radius:15px;border:1px solid #e6e6e6;border-collapse:collapse;box-shadow:none;margin-bottom:0px">
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding: 15px;">
<h3 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0">
INEQUALITY
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2020/06/12/coronavirus-exposes-us-healthcare-flaws?email={{profile.email}}" target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;">
<font color="#000000">
COVID-19 Gives U.S. Healthcare a C-
</font></a>
</h1>
</td>
</tr>
</table>
<img alt="Medical workers hug" style="display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;" width="670" class="story-header-image" src="https://dlp31coh2a67q.cloudfront.net/eyJrZXkiOiJ1cGxvYWRzL21lZGl1bS9hc3NldC8xMzI3L21lZGljYWxfd29ya2Vyc19odWcuanBnIiwiYnVja2V0Ijoib3Nsby1wcm9kdWN0aW9uIiwiZWRpdHMiOnsicmVzaXplIjp7IndpZHRoIjoxMDAwLCJoZWlnaHQiOm51bGx9fX0=">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px;">
<small><em>Noam Galai/Getty Images</em></small>
</p>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding:15px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">The coronavirus pandemic has made painfully clear all the ways the U.S. healthcare system hasn’t lived up to Miranda Bailey’s expectations. </p>
<h2 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0">No. 1: Unequal outcomes </h2>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Preliminary data shows black Americans were disproportionally harmed in this crisis. For example, black people <a href="https://www.newyorker.com/news/q-and-a/the-coronavirus-and-the-interwoven-threads-of-inequality-and-health?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">account for</a> 14% of Illinois’s population, but more than 40% of its confirmed coronavirus deaths in mid-April. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">What happened? Inequalities that existed pre-pandemic (less flexible working arrangements, greater likelihood of pre-existing conditions, less access to medical care) amplified the virus’s impact on vulnerable populations. </p>
<h2 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0">No. 2: Employer-based healthcare </h2>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">With businesses caught between a tanking economy and a workforce that needs reliable healthcare, some policy wonks <a href="https://www.statnews.com/2020/05/19/9-ways-covid-19-forever-upend-health-care/?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">are proposing</a> major changes. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Some conservatives advocate for health reimbursement arrangements (HRAs), where employers pay workers for healthcare costs directly rather than offering insurance through a company-based plan. Progressives say the crisis shows it’s time for universal healthcare.</p>
<h2 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0">No. 3: Doctor burnout and misaligned incentives</h2>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">“For years the U.S. healthcare system has strained doctors and nurses with demands that place financial interests above patient care, making the practice of medicine unbearable,” a Rhode Island emergency and critical care doctor <a href="https://www.statnews.com/2020/04/23/covid-19-aftermath-no-return-to-business-as-usual/?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">wrote</a> for STAT. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Bottom line: </strong>Medical experts think that COVID-19, by exposing the numerous flaws in the U.S.' current healthcare system, could accelerate significant policy shifts in the industry.</p>

<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<th class="card" style="text-align:left;font-weight:400;font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#333;display:block;background-color:#fff;border-radius:15px;border:1px solid #e6e6e6;border-collapse:collapse;box-shadow:none;margin-bottom:0px">
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding: 15px;">
<h3 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0">
LONG-TERM CARE
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2020/06/12/coronavirus-poses-existential-threat-nursing-homes?email={{profile.email}}" target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;">
<font color="#000000">
Homes > Nursing Homes
</font></a>
</h1>
</td>
</tr>
</table>
<img alt="Senior in wheelchair on his porch" style="display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;" width="670" class="story-header-image" src="https://dlp31coh2a67q.cloudfront.net/eyJrZXkiOiJ1cGxvYWRzL21lZGl1bS9hc3NldC8xMzI4L3Nlbmlvcl9pbl93aGVlbGNoYWlyLmpwZyIsImJ1Y2tldCI6Im9zbG8tcHJvZHVjdGlvbiIsImVkaXRzIjp7InJlc2l6ZSI6eyJ3aWR0aCI6MTAwMCwiaGVpZ2h0IjpudWxsfX19">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px;">
<small><em>Getty Images</em></small>
</p>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding:15px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">As of last month, one-third of COVID-19 deaths in the U.S. were residents or workers at nursing homes and other long-term care facilities, <a href="https://www.nytimes.com/interactive/2020/05/09/us/coronavirus-cases-nursing-homes-us.html?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">according to the NYT</a>. </p>
<h2 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0">How did it happen?</h2>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>
</span><span><strong style="color:#000">Lack of protection</strong></span><span>: One-fifth of U.S. nursing homes reported a </span><span><a href="https://www.mcknights.com/news/clinical-news/ppe-shortage-reported-by-one-fifth-of-nations-nursing-homes/?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">shortage</a></span><span> of personal protective equipment in late May, per a Kaiser Health News analysis. </span>
</li>
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>
</span><span><strong style="color:#000">Lack of staff:</strong></span><span> A </span><span><a href="https://www.reuters.com/article/us-health-coronavirus-nursinghomes-speci/special-report-pandemic-exposes-systemic-staffing-problems-at-u-s-nursing-homes-idUSKBN23H1L9?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">Reuters analysis</a></span><span> of federal data found that about a quarter of nursing homes reported direct-care staffing shortages in the second half of May. </span>
</li>
</ul>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">The problem isn’t confined to the U.S. In Canada, nursing homes <a href="https://www.washingtonpost.com/world/the_americas/coronavirus-canada-long-term-care-nursing-homes/2020/05/18/01494ad4-947f-11ea-87a3-22d324235636_story.html?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">accounted</a> for 81% of COVID-19 deaths as of May 18. </p>
<h2 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0">What might change</h2>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">The model underpinning the long-term care industry. </strong>Nursing homes are valuable because they consolidate care for the elderly. </p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>But with consolidation acting as coronavirus kindling, the nursing home as we know it might never return. </span></li>
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>We'll likely see a </span><span><a href="https://www.barrons.com/articles/demand-for-home-care-is-expected-to-boom-finding-it-might-not-be-so-easy-51590840002?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">huge shift in demand</a></span><span> toward home-care. By 2026, the U.S. home-care industry will need to fill 4.2 million jobs, per PHI research. And that forecast was made </span><span><em>before </em></span><span>the pandemic.</span>
</li>
</ul>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Bottom line:</strong> Grace-Marie Turner, president of the free-market think tank Galen Institute, thinks the shift is fueled by more than coronavirus fears. “People want their own independent life,” she told STAT.</p>

<td style="padding: 15px;">
<h3 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0">
SPONSORED BY CARIUMA
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a href="#" target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;">
<font color="#000000">
Are Your Feet Ready for the Heat?
</font></a>
</h1>

<a href="https://cariuma.com/pages/mb-jun20?utm_source=morningbrew&utm_medium=sponsored+email&utm_campaign=weekly_A&utm_content=x13Jun20" style="text-decoration:none;border:none;" target="_blank" class="">

</a>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px;">
<small><em></em></small>
</p>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding:15px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Summertime is upon us, and hot days call for even hotter sneakers. That’s why the Brew Crew is gearing up for summer with <a href="https://cariuma.com/pages/mb-jun20?utm_source=morningbrew&utm_medium=sponsored+email&utm_campaign=weekly_A&utm_content=x13Jun20" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">CARIUMA’s sustainable sneaks</a>.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">This summer treat for your feet is the <strong style="color:#000">most sustainable, comfortable, and stylish thing that has ever happened to traditional footwear.</strong> <a href="https://cariuma.com/pages/mb-jun20?utm_source=morningbrew&utm_medium=sponsored+email&utm_campaign=weekly_A&utm_content=x13Jun20" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">CARIUMA</a> sneakers bring summer wherever you are with a variety of bright colors that are just as good-looking as they are consciously-made. </p>

<!-- <![endif]-->
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<th class="card" style="text-align:left;font-weight:400;font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#333;display:block;background-color:#fff;border-radius:15px;border:1px solid #e6e6e6;border-collapse:collapse;box-shadow:none;margin-bottom:0px">
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding: 15px;">
<h3 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0">
MENTAL HEALTH
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2020/06/12/mental-health-pandemic?email={{profile.email}}" target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;">
<font color="#000000">
Will Our Brains Ever Be the Same?
</font></a>
</h1>
</td>
</tr>
</table>
<!--[if mso]>
<img alt="Patrick meditating" style="display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;" width="670" height=444 src="https://media.giphy.com/media/H7kfFDvD9HSYGRbvid/giphy.gif">
<![endif]-->
<!--[if !mso]>--><!-- -->
<img class="story-header-image" alt="Patrick meditating" style="display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;" width="670" src="https://media.giphy.com/media/H7kfFDvD9HSYGRbvid/giphy.gif">
<!--<![endif]-->
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px;">
<small><em>Giphy</em></small>
</p>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding:15px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">According to health psychologist Elke Van Hoof, worldwide lockdowns brought on by COVID-19 have <a href="https://www.scientificamerican.com/interactive/the-biggest-psychological-experiment-in-history-is-running-now/?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">set the stage</a> for "arguably the largest psychological experiment ever conducted."</p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>As they cope with isolation, an economic recession, and stress about the virus itself, 45% of U.S. adults told the Kaiser Family Foundation their mental health </span><span><a href="https://www.globalmed.com/mental-health-is-the-next-pandemic/?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">got worse</a></span><span>. </span>
</li>
</ul>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">The hypothesis: </strong>When this is all over, researchers will know how well human brains cope with a long-lasting traumatic event—without the benefit of frequent human contact, established routines, and in-person mental health care. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">It doesn’t help that when it comes to government support...</p>
<h2 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0">Mental health’s getting the short end of the stethoscope</h2>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">The $425 million set aside in the CARES Act for the Substance Abuse and Mental Health Services Administration is less than a <a href="https://www.theatlantic.com/ideas/archive/2020/05/coming-mental-health-crisis/611635/?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">quarter of 1%</a> of the $185 billion invested in healthcare providers altogether.</p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>Nearly two-thirds of community behavioral health organizations say they’ll shut down in three months or less. </span></li>
</ul>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Meanwhile..</strong>.teletherapy services are booming. Talkspace and BetterHelp <a href="https://www.cnbc.com/2020/05/24/mental-health-apps-draw-wave-of-users-as-experts-call-for-oversight.html?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">reported a surge</a> in new users this year, and meditation app Headspace <a href="https://news.crunchbase.com/news/meditation-app-headspace-secures-47-7m-more-in-funding-filing-shows/?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">secured</a> $47.7 million in new funding. We don’t know yet if virtual appointments and aids can replace in-person care, but experts are optimistic.</p>

<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<th class="card" style="text-align:left;font-weight:400;font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#333;display:block;background-color:#fff;border-radius:15px;border:1px solid #e6e6e6;border-collapse:collapse;box-shadow:none;margin-bottom:0px">
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding: 15px;">
<h3 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0">
PREPAREDNESS
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2020/06/12/medical-community-tries-learn-coronavirus-mistakes?email={{profile.email}}" target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;">
<font color="#000000">
The Next Pandemic: When, Not If
</font></a>
</h1>
</td>
</tr>
</table>
<img alt="Bill Gates" style="display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;" width="670" class="story-header-image" src="https://dlp31coh2a67q.cloudfront.net/eyJrZXkiOiJ1cGxvYWRzL21lZGl1bS9hc3NldC8xMzI1L2JpbGxfZ2F0ZXMuanBnIiwiYnVja2V0Ijoib3Nsby1wcm9kdWN0aW9uIiwiZWRpdHMiOnsicmVzaXplIjp7IndpZHRoIjoxMDAwLCJoZWlnaHQiOm51bGx9fX0=">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px;">
<small><em>World Economic Forum</em></small>
</p>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding:15px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">In a 2015 Ted Talk, Bill Gates <a href="https://www.ted.com/talks/bill_gates_the_next_outbreak_we_re_not_ready?language=en#t-44826&utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">declared</a>, “If anything kills over 10 million people in the next few decades, it’s most likely to be a highly infectious virus.” </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">He probably should have said “viruses.” As humans crisscross the globe with increasing frequency, dive deeper into natural ecosystems, and contribute to climate change, medical experts warn it’s basically inevitable we’ll experience more viral outbreaks. </p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>“You asked what keeps me up at night,” CDC Director Robert Redfield </span><span><a href="https://news.yahoo.com/nation-not-prepared-for-next-pandemic-184538844.html?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">told</a></span><span> a House committee. “I know it’s a pandemic flu.”</span>
</li>
</ul>
<h2 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0">So what have we learned from COVID-19? </h2>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">That we need to do a lot better next time around. Here are a few proposed solutions from medical experts...<strong style="color:#000"></strong></p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>
</span><span><strong style="color:#000">More funding: </strong></span><span>Redfield told Congress that his agency didn’t have the money to fulfill the “core capabilities of public health.” The UN says we need to spend </span><span><a href="https://www.un.org/en/un-chronicle/modernizing-our-public-health-systems-be-ready-next-pandemic?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">$11 billion more</a></span><span> to fight global pandemics.</span>
</li>
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>
</span><span><strong style="color:#000">Reforming the WHO: </strong></span><span>Global cooperation is critical to fighting a pandemic, but critics argue the World Health Organization has </span><span><a href="https://www.thinkglobalhealth.org/article/who-we-need-next-pandemic?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">serious flaws</a></span><span> in its design.</span>
</li>
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>
</span><span><strong style="color:#000">Strengthening the medical supply chain </strong></span><span>to ensure critical drugs are available </span><span><a href="https://cen.acs.org/business/outsourcing/COVID-19-reshaping-pharmaceutical-supply/98/i16?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">when needed</a></span><span>.</span>
</li>
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>
</span><span><strong style="color:#000">More surveillance: </strong></span><span>As David Ecker </span><span><a href="https://blogs.scientificamerican.com/observations/how-to-snuff-out-the-next-pandemic/?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">writes</a></span><span> in Scientific American, “The best way to prevent pandemics is to apply the same principles as we use to prevent catastrophic forest fires: survey aggressively for smaller brush fires and stomp them out immediately.”</span>
</li>
</ul>

<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding-right:15px;padding-bottom:15px;padding-left:15px;padding-top:0px">

\u003c/strong\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003eStocks \u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e\u003ca href=\"https://apnews.com/c7ca1b89a951134757ba0ae9e7016127?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003erebounded\u003c/a\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e just a bit following the worst trading day in months. Investors tried to swallow a new report from the Fed, which warned “the path ahead is extraordinarily uncertain” for the U.S. economy.\u003c/span\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\n\u003cspan\u003e\n\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eWorld: \u003c/strong\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003eOne thing is certain—the UK's economy \u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e\u003ca href=\"https://apnews.com/b549f27b907ab4fa04db52815811e78c?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003etanked\u003c/a\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e in April. By shrinking more than 20%, the economy essentially wiped out all growth from 2002.\u003c/span\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003c/ul\u003e\n\u003c/td\u003e\n\u003c/tr\u003e\n\u003c/table\u003e\n\u003c/th\u003e\n\u003c/tr\u003e\n\u003c/table\u003e\n\u003c!--[if !mso ]\u003e\u003c! -- --\u003e\n\u003c/div\u003e\n\u003c/div\u003e\n\u003c!-- \u003c![endif]--\u003e\n\u003c!-- END MARKETS --\u003e\n\u003c!-- ARTICLE ---\u003e\n\u003c!--[if !mso ]\u003e\u003c! -- --\u003e\n\u003cdiv class=\"c6 \" style=\"margin-bottom:7px\"\u003e\n\u003c!-- \u003c![endif]--\u003e\n\u003ctable width=\"100%\" cellpadding=\"0\" cellspacing=\"0\" border=\"0\" style=\"border-collapse: collapse;\"\u003e\n\u003ctr\u003e\n\u003cth class=\"card\" style=\"text-align:left;font-weight:400;font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#333;display:block;background-color:#fff;border-radius:15px;border:1px solid #e6e6e6;border-collapse:collapse;box-shadow:none;margin-bottom:0px\"\u003e\n\u003ctable width=\"100%\" cellpadding=\"0\" cellspacing=\"0\" border=\"0\" style=\"border-collapse: collapse;\"\u003e\n\u003ctr\u003e\n\u003ctd style=\"padding: 15px;\"\u003e\n\u003ch3 style=\"font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0\"\u003e\nTELEMEDICINE\n\u003c/h3\u003e\n\u003ch1 style=\"font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px\"\u003e\n\u003ca href=\"https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2020/06/12/telemedicine-soars-pandemic-restrictions?email={{profile.email}}\" target=\"_blank\" style=\"color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;\"\u003e\n\u003cfont color=\"#000000\"\u003e\nWaiting Rooms, We Won’t Miss You\n\u003c/font\u003e\u003c/a\u003e\n\u003c/h1\u003e\n\u003c/td\u003e\n\u003c/tr\u003e\n\u003c/table\u003e\n\u003cimg alt=\"Telemedicine\" style=\"display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;\" width=\"670\" class=\"story-header-image\" src=\"https://dlp31coh2a67q.cloudfront.net/eyJrZXkiOiJ1cGxvYWRzL21lZGl1bS9hc3NldC8xMzI5L3RlbGVtZWRpY2luZS5qcGciLCJidWNrZXQiOiJvc2xvLXByb2R1Y3Rpb24iLCJlZGl0cyI6eyJyZXNpemUiOnsid2lkdGgiOjEwMDAsImhlaWdodCI6bnVsbH19fQ==\"\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px;\"\u003e\n\u003csmall\u003e\u003cem\u003eFrancis Scialabba\u003c/em\u003e\u003c/small\u003e\n\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003ctable width=\"100%\" cellpadding=\"0\" cellspacing=\"0\" border=\"0\" style=\"border-collapse: collapse;\"\u003e\n\u003ctr\u003e\n\u003ctd style=\"padding:15px\"\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eThe coronavirus pandemic has resulted in never-before-seen experiments around remote work, the metaverse, and finally embracing leggings as real pants. It’s also created a budding star in healthcare: telemedicine.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cul style=\"margin-top:0;padding-left:30px\"\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\u003cspan\u003eThe U.S. government defines telemedicine as the use of information and communication technologies to provide clinical healthcare services. “Telehealth” implies both clinical and non-clinical services, though it's often used interchangeably with telemedicine.\u003c/span\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003c/ul\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eCOVID-19 could be the tipping point.\u003c/strong\u003e Virtual doctor visits jumped from ~12,000/week to more than 1 million/week during the pandemic. “Physicians have now basically crossed the rubicon,” NY Presbyterian CEO Steven Corwin \u003ca href=\"https://fortune.com/2020/06/11/coronavirus-covid-19-pandemic-telehealth-brainstorm-health/?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003etold Fortune\u003c/a\u003e.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003ch2 style=\"font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0\"\u003eSo what's in the way?\u003c/h2\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eWhile it's not new, telemedicine hasn’t been a top priority for providers or insurers. Virtual visits can be \u003ca href=\"https://www.nationalgeographic.com/science/2020/06/why-rural-hospitals-may-not-survive-coronavirus-telemedicine/#close?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003eless profitable\u003c/a\u003e than in-person services, especially for rural hospitals. Regulatory barriers have also \u003ca href=\"https://www.brookings.edu/research/removing-regulatory-barriers-to-telehealth-before-and-after-covid-19/?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003ecreated uncertainty\u003c/a\u003e around telemedicine’s future.  \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eFor patients, Medicare, Medicaid, or insurance don’t always cover the cost of virtual care. In rural areas (where telehealth is \u003cem\u003eespecially\u003c/em\u003e helpful in plugging healthcare gaps), many people lack tech or broadband access.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003ch2 style=\"font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0\"\u003eThe COVID-19 pilot \u003c/h2\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eWhen the pandemic began, federal officials relaxed telemedicine rules. They \u003ca href=\"https://www.kff.org/womens-health-policy/issue-brief/opportunities-and-barriers-for-telemedicine-in-the-u-s-during-the-covid-19-emergency-and-beyond/?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003ewaived\u003c/a\u003e certain Medicare requirements and allowed doctors to practice across state lines and virtually prescribe more medications. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cul style=\"margin-top:0;padding-left:30px\"\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\u003cspan\u003eMany states also expanded Medicaid telehealth coverage and relaxed licensing restrictions. Some required that private insurance plans cover and reimburse telemedicine as much as in-person visits. \u003c/span\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003c/ul\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eCenters for Medicare and Medicaid Services Administrator Seema Verma is pleased with early results and wants the U.S. to continue \u003ca href=\"https://www.statnews.com/2020/06/09/seema-verma-telehealth-access-covid19/?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003eexpanding\u003c/a\u003e telemedicine access. But there are still some wrinkles to iron out, including...\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cul style=\"margin-top:0;padding-left:30px\"\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\u003cspan\u003eWhether Medicare/Medicaid should pay out the same for virtual appointments\u003c/span\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\u003cspan\u003eExpanding eligible services to include emergency care, physical therapy, and mental health \u003c/span\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\u003cspan\u003eBringing virtual care to home consults, hospices, and nursing homes\u003c/span\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\u003cspan\u003eEasing licensing rules so telemedicine can cross state lines  \u003c/span\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003c/ul\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eLooking ahead...\u003c/strong\u003eVerma said health officials are searching for ways to boost telemedicine. However, only Congress can permanently expand it to more patients and healthcare plans.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003c!-- SOCIAL LINKS --\u003e\n\u003ctable width=\"100%\" cellpadding=\"0\" cellspacing=\"0\" C-\n\u003c/font\u003e\u003c/a\u003e\n\u003c/h1\u003e\n\u003c/td\u003e\n\u003c/tr\u003e\n\u003c/table\u003e\n\u003cimg alt=\"Medical workers hug\" style=\"display: block; width: 100%; max-width: Images\u003c/em\u003e\u003c/small\u003e\n\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003ctable width=\"100%\" cellpadding=\"0\" cellspacing=\"0\" border=\"0\" style=\"border-collapse: collapse;\"\u003e\n\u003ctr\u003e\n\u003ctd style=\"padding:15px\"\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eThe coronavirus pandemic has made painfully clear all the ways the U.S. healthcare system hasn’t lived up to Miranda Bailey’s expectations. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003ch2 style=\"font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0\"\u003eNo. 1: Unequal outcomes \u003c/h2\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003ePreliminary data shows black Americans were disproportionally harmed in this crisis. For example, black people \u003ca href=\"https://www.newyorker.com/news/q-and-a/the-coronavirus-and-the-interwoven-threads-of-inequality-and-health?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003eaccount for\u003c/a\u003e 14% of Illinois’s population, but more than 40% of its confirmed coronavirus deaths in mid-April. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eWhat happened? Inequalities that existed pre-pandemic (less flexible working arrangements, greater likelihood of pre-existing conditions, less access to medical care) amplified the virus’s impact on vulnerable populations. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003ch2 style=\"font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0\"\u003eNo. 2: Employer-based healthcare \u003c/h2\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eWith businesses caught between a tanking economy and a workforce that needs reliable healthcare, some policy wonks \u003ca href=\"https://www.statnews.com/2020/05/19/9-ways-covid-19-forever-upend-health-care/?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003eare proposing\u003c/a\u003e major changes. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eSome conservatives advocate for health reimbursement arrangements (HRAs), where employers pay workers for healthcare costs directly rather than offering insurance through a company-based plan. Progressives say the crisis shows it’s time for universal healthcare.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003ch2 style=\"font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0\"\u003eNo. 3: Doctor burnout and misaligned incentives\u003c/h2\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e“For years the U.S. healthcare system has strained doctors and nurses with demands that place financial interests above patient care, making the practice of medicine unbearable,” a Rhode Island emergency and critical care doctor \u003ca href=\"https://www.statnews.com/2020/04/23/covid-19-aftermath-no-return-to-business-as-usual/?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003ewrote\u003c/a\u003e for STAT. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eBottom line: \u003c/strong\u003eMedical experts think that COVID-19, by exposing the numerous flaws in the U.S.' current healthcare system, could accelerate significant policy shifts in the industry.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003c!-- SOCIAL LINKS --\u003e\n\u003ctable width=\"100%\" cellpadding=\"0\" cellspacing=\"0\" border=\"0\" style=\"border-collapse: collapse;\"\u003e\n\u003ctr\u003e\n\u003ctd style=\"padding:15px\"\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eAs of last month, one-third of COVID-19 deaths in the U.S. were residents or workers at nursing homes and other long-term care facilities, \u003ca href=\"https://www.nytimes.com/interactive/2020/05/09/us/coronavirus-cases-nursing-homes-us.html?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003eaccording to the NYT\u003c/a\u003e. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003ch2 style=\"font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0\"\u003eHow did it happen?\u003c/h2\u003e\r\n\u003cul style=\"margin-top:0;padding-left:30px\"\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\n\u003cspan\u003e\n\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eLack of protection\u003c/strong\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e: One-fifth of U.S. nursing homes reported a \u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e\u003ca href=\"https://www.mcknights.com/news/clinical-news/ppe-shortage-reported-by-one-fifth-of-nations-nursing-homes/?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003eshortage\u003c/a\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e of personal protective equipment in late May, per a Kaiser Health News analysis. \u003c/span\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\n\u003cspan\u003e\n\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eLack of staff:\u003c/strong\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e A \u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e\u003ca href=\"https://www.reuters.com/article/us-health-coronavirus-nursinghomes-speci/special-report-pandemic-exposes-systemic-staffing-problems-at-u-s-nursing-homes-idUSKBN23H1L9?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003eReuters analysis\u003c/a\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e of federal data found that about a quarter of nursing homes reported direct-care staffing shortages in the second half of May. \u003c/span\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003c/ul\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eThe problem isn’t confined to the U.S. In Canada, nursing homes \u003ca href=\"https://www.washingtonpost.com/world/the_americas/coronavirus-canada-long-term-care-nursing-homes/2020/05/18/01494ad4-947f-11ea-87a3-22d324235636_story.html?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003eaccounted\u003c/a\u003e for 81% of COVID-19 deaths as of May 18. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003ch2 style=\"font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0\"\u003eWhat might change\u003c/h2\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eThe model underpinning the long-term care industry. \u003c/strong\u003eNursing homes are valuable because they consolidate care for the elderly. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cul style=\"margin-top:0;padding-left:30px\"\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\u003cspan\u003eBut with consolidation acting as coronavirus kindling, the nursing home as we know it might never return. \u003c/span\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\n\u003cspan\u003eWe'll likely see a \u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e\u003ca href=\"https://www.barrons.com/articles/demand-for-home-care-is-expected-to-boom-finding-it-might-not-be-so-easy-51590840002?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003ehuge shift in demand\u003c/a\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e toward home-care. By 2026, the U.S. home-care industry will need to fill 4.2 million jobs, per PHI research. And that forecast was made \u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e\u003cem\u003ebefore \u003c/em\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003ethe pandemic.\u003c/span\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003c/ul\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eBottom line:\u003c/strong\u003e Grace-Marie Turner, president of the free-market think tank Galen Institute, thinks the shift is fueled by more than coronavirus fears. “People want their own independent style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eAccording to health psychologist Elke Van Hoof, worldwide lockdowns brought on by COVID-19 have \u003ca href=\"https://www.scientificamerican.com/interactive/the-biggest-psychological-experiment-in-history-is-running-now/?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003eset the stage\u003c/a\u003e for \"arguably the largest psychological experiment ever conducted.\"\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cul style=\"margin-top:0;padding-left:30px\"\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\n\u003cspan\u003eAs they cope with isolation, an economic recession, and stress about the virus itself, 45% of U.S. adults told the Kaiser Family Foundation their mental health \u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e\u003ca href=\"https://www.globalmed.com/mental-health-is-the-next-pandemic/?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003egot worse\u003c/a\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e. \u003c/span\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003c/ul\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eThe hypothesis: \u003c/strong\u003eWhen this is all over, researchers will know how well human brains cope with a long-lasting traumatic event—without the benefit of frequent human contact, established routines, and in-person mental health care. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eIt doesn’t help that when it comes to government support...\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003ch2 style=\"font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0\"\u003eMental health’s getting the short end of the stethoscope\u003c/h2\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eThe $425 million set aside in the CARES Act for the Substance Abuse and Mental Health Services Administration is less than a \u003ca href=\"https://www.theatlantic.com/ideas/archive/2020/05/coming-mental-health-crisis/611635/?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003equarter of 1%\u003c/a\u003e of the $185 billion invested in healthcare providers altogether.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cul style=\"margin-top:0;padding-left:30px\"\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\u003cspan\u003eNearly two-thirds of community behavioral health organizations say they’ll shut down in three months or less. \u003c/span\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003c/ul\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eMeanwhile..\u003c/strong\u003e.teletherapy services are booming. Talkspace and BetterHelp \u003ca href=\"https://www.cnbc.com/2020/05/24/mental-health-apps-draw-wave-of-users-as-experts-call-for-oversight.html?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003ereported a surge\u003c/a\u003e in new users this year, and meditation app Headspace \u003ca href=\"https://news.crunchbase.com/news/meditation-app-headspace-secures-47-7m-more-in-funding-filing-shows/?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003esecured\u003c/a\u003e $47.7 million in new funding.
